MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to make provision for the purpose of enabling certain mortgage borrowers to switch to a new mortgage arrangement; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: WAYS AND MEANS: ADJOURNED DEBATE ON QUESTION [7 MARCH]

MotionText.from_cdata: 1. Income tax (charge) That income tax is charged for the tax year 2024-25. And it is declared that it is expedient in the public interest that this Resolution should have statutory effect under the provisions of the Provisional Collection of Taxes Act 1968.

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: 'helvetica neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

p.span: For the remaining Budget Motions, numbers 2 to 25, and the associated Money Motion, see separate paper. Those motions are to be moved at the conclusion of the Budget debate, immediately after the decision on the motion before the House on Income tax (charge). They will be decided without further debate (Standing Order No. 51(3)).

MotionText.from_cdata: That notices of Amendments, new Clauses and new Schedules to be moved in Committee in respect of the National Insurance Contributions (Reduction in Rates) (No. 2) Bill may be accepted by the Clerks at the Table before it has been read a second time.

root.MotionSponsor: Sir Bill Wiggin, ,on behalf of the Committee of Selection

MotionText.from_cdata: That David Simmonds be discharged from the Joint Committee on Human Rights and Miss Sarah Dines be added.

root.MotionSponsor: Sir Bill Wiggin, ,on behalf of the Committee of Selection

MotionText.from_cdata: That Emma Hardy be discharged from the Treasury Committee and Samantha Dixon be added.

root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 10.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Zero total allowable catch for pollack: Steve Double
root.DebateTimingRubric: The sitting will last for up to three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).
root.MotionText: That this House has considered e-petition 608237 relating to prescription charges for people with chronic or long-term health conditions: Tonia Antoniazzi

from_cdata.p: The subject for this debate was determined by the Petitions Committee. The sitting will last for up to three hours. The sitting will be suspended and time added if divisions take place in the main Chamber (Standing Order No. 10(3)).
e-petition 633794, Free prescriptions for all cystic fibrosis (CF) patients
e-petition 622971, Include Sickle Cell Anemia in the List of Illnesses Eligible for a MedEx Card
e-petition 621375, Allow those diagnosed with Crohn’s and Colitis to access Medical Exemption card
e-petition 588355, Add Sickle Cell to the Prescription Charge Exemption List
e-petition 333926, Include Sickle Cell Anemia in the List of Illnesses Eligible for a MedEx Card
e-petition 328047, Add Crohn’s & Colitis to the Medically Exempt Certificate
e-petition 326574, Make prescriptions free for everyone with Cystic Fibrosis
